clinical_study.brief_title: New Strategies of Genetic Study of Patients With Oculocutaneous Albinism
clinical_study.official_title: New Strategies of Genetic Study of Patients With Oculocutaneous Albinism

brief_summary.textblock: The oculocutaneous albinism is an autosomal recessive condition associated with mutations in 4 genes. In 20% of patients no mutation is identified. The optimization of genetic analysis methods and the search for new genes involved will help improve the diagnosis in these patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
The oculocutaneous albinism is an autosomal recessive condition associated with mutations in 4 genes. In 20% of patients no mutation is identified. The optimization of genetic analysis methods and the search for new genes involved will help improve the diagnosis in these patients.
.

primary_outcome.description: Analysis by CGH (Comparative Genomic Hybridization) array : The Log2 values of the patient / reference fluorescence intensity ratios (Log2R) are -1 in the case of a heterozygous deletion, 0.5 in the case of heterozygous duplication and 0 in the absence of rearrangement.
By sequencing candidate genes : homozygotic cartography and candidate gene sequencing

intervention.description: Analysis by CGH array, homozygotic cartography and candidate gene sequencing

biospec_descr.textblock: Samples (2 blood tubes or 1 aliquot of DNA) are recorded in the DNA bank because were collected during the genetic consultation of these patients

study_pop.textblock: Patients having been examined during a genetic consultation, with Oculocutaneous Albinism

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Oculocutaneous albinism (diagnosis validated by a clinician at the initial genetic consultation and did not show mutations of the TYR, OCA2, TYRP1, SLC45A2 genes)
Exclusion Criteria:
None
